Loop through yearly CSV files water-body-testing-2020–2023 and read each into a dataframe.
Keep only rows where Beach Type Description == 'Fresh' to restrict analysis to fresh-water beaches.
Standardize the Beach Name by splitting on '@' and retaining the first part so the same beach is counted once across years.
For every year, compute per-beach sample count and per-beach violation count (rows whose Violation column equals 'yes' case-insensitively).
Calculate the yearly exceedance rate for each beach as violations / total samples and store it in a column Exceedance Rate <year>.
Keep only the Beach Name and its yearly exceedance-rate column; collect these per-year dataframes in a list.
Inner-merge the yearly dataframes on Beach Name so that only beaches appearing in every year 2020–2023 are retained, satisfying the ‘measured in all years’ requirement.
Across the retained yearly rate columns, compute the row-wise mean to obtain each beach’s average exceedance rate since 2020.
Sort beaches by this average exceedance rate in descending order and output the Beach Name with the highest value as the most polluted fresh-water beach.
